title: World Stadiums Quiz
description: From ancient arenas to modern sporting cathedrals, test your knowledge of the world's most famous stadiums.

questions.question: The Maracanã Stadium, which hosted two FIFA World Cup finals, is located in which city?
Wembley Stadium, England's national football stadium, is located in which city?
Camp Nou, one of the largest football stadiums in Europe, is the home ground of which club?
The Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), often called 'The G,' can hold approximately how many spectators?
The Bird's Nest stadium, designed for the 2008 Summer Olympics, is located in which city?
Madison Square Garden, known as 'The World's Most Famous Arena,' is located in which borough of New York City?
The Allianz Arena in Munich is known for its exterior that can change to which colors?
The Rose Bowl, famous for its annual college football game, is located in which California city?
The Azteca Stadium, which hosted two FIFA World Cup finals (1970 and 1986), is in which city?
Lord's Cricket Ground, known as 'The Home of Cricket,' is located in which city?
The Rungrado 1st of May Day Stadium, the largest stadium in the world by capacity, is in which country?
Yankee Stadium, home of the New York Yankees baseball team, is located in which borough?
The Santiago Bernabéu Stadium is the home ground of which Spanish football club?
The Olympic Stadium designed by Zaha Hadid for the 2020 Olympics was NOT built. Which architect's design was used instead?
Lambeau Field, known as 'The Frozen Tundra,' is the home stadium of which NFL team?
